item.title: Summer Parking Permits Now Available for Purchase
item.description: Students enrolled in summer classes and Arch: Summer parking permits are now on sale! Please be sure to purchased your summer parking permit to avoid any parking violations. Permits are required on all Rensselaer property. To register please visit: https://rpi.aimsparking.com If you have any questions, please contact Parking and Transportation at 518-276-6616 or parking@rpi.edu. Drive safely and have a great summer semester!

item.title: Game Development Camp to be Held July 14-18
item.description: The Game Development Camp is a summer camp for Middle Schoolers and High Schoolers looking to jump start their game development careers at RPI. This 1 week long camp teaches students the basics of Game Design, Art, Animation, Audio, and Programming while taking a more serious look at video games and how they are made. Registration below. Join us July 14-18 in SAGE 2411. https://hass.rpi.edu/rpi-game-development-camp

item.title: Get setup for with passwordless single sign on
item.description: You can use your device or laptop biometrics to login to RPI’s single sign on. Our SSO works with TouchID/FaceID, Andriod Biometrics, and Windows Hello.

item.title: Early registration is open for Qiskit Global Summer School 2025
item.description: Early registration is open for Qiskit Global Summer School 2025. Qiskit Global Summer School is an opportunity to learn quantum programming from researchers and programmers at IBM through live lectures, Q&A with experts, and programming challenges. Previous years’ lessons are available on the Qiskit YouTube Channel. This year’s theme is Qiskit Global Summer School 2025: The Past, Present, and Future of Quantum Computing. The class runs remotely July 7-22, 2025.

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: “Supervisory Essentials”
item.description:
In this seminar, Managers and Supervisors will learn from each other and our Facilitators about important topics such as the Employee Value Proposition and Employee Experience, the six fundamental Leadership competencies at Rensselaer, and experience several “Supervisory Simulations” with colleagues. In addition, the importance of coaching employee performance, providing both rewards and recognition, employment law fundamentals and tools for building team capacity will be explored.
